intro: Nicotiana rusbyi, commonly known as Rusby's tobacco, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a waxy coating, while its stems are erect and somewhat hairy. This species is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its ornamental value and unique ecological adaptations.
